title: Covid-19: Five years on, the time to pay the economic bill has come
summary: For almost two years, economies around the world were partially suspended. An explosion of debt and soaring prices have been the direct consequences of this.

title: Alarm bells are sounding for academic freedom in the US and beyond
summary: According to an annual report, the academic freedom index has fallen substantially in 34 of the 179 countries surveyed.

title: Israeli airstrikes kill 10 in Gaza, Lebanon, and Syria amid fragile ceasefire
summary: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, southern Lebanon, and southern Syria on Monday left at least 10 people dead, including a child, as tensions rise during fragile ceasefires in the region. The Israeli military claimed it was targeting militants involved in plotting attacks.

title: Canadian PM Carney says his country must bolster ties with 'reliable allies'
summary: Speaking in a joint press conference with President Emmanuel Macron, Canada's new prime minister, cited France as a 'reliable' ally, amid a tense context marked by US President Donald Trump's tariff pressure and expansionist rhetoric toward Canada.

title: M23 pulls out of planned peace talks in Angola
summary: The armed group withdrew last-minute from peace talks after the EU imposed sanctions on some of its members. It comes after Rwanda cut diplomatic ties with Belgium.

title: Who really was Saint Patrick? From mystical visions to beer festivals
summary: Between history, spirituality and legend, the figure of Saint Patrick, who has become a key element of a tormented Irish identity, tells the story of the slow Christianization of an island that has never completely abandoned its ancestral traditions.

title: Over 600 migrants rescued, 18 bodies recovered off Tunisia's coast in deadly Mediterranean crossing attempt
summary: Tunisia's national guard has rescued 612 migrants and recovered the bodies of 18 others after a series of tragic boat capsizings off the Mediterranean coast. The victims were attempting to reach Europe when their vessels broke down or capsized during perilous crossings.

title: European data debunk misinformation about gender transitions
summary: As the US passes transphobic laws on disputed scientific grounds, a new analysis of a survey of over 135,000 European LGBT citizens finds no more health problems among young transmasculine people with a strong presence on social media.

title: In Syria's coastal villages, the Alawite community feels abandoned by the new authorities: 'We want the attackers to be punished'
summary: Between March 7 and 9, the towns of al-Sanobar and Huraysun were taken over by Islamist factions allied with the new Syrian authorities. The assailants looted and burned houses and massacred dozens of inhabitants, whom they suspected of being supporters of the former regime. Survivors, still in shock and terrified, tell the story.

title: At Le Scouarnec's child abuse trial, the victims' sobs, anger and trauma
summary: According to the investigation, many of the hundreds of people raped and abused as children by the surgeon only learned of the facts from the police. They recounted their shock before the Brittany criminal court.

title: 'Never been closer to a peace deal,' says White House ahead of Ukraine talks between Putin and Trump on Tuesday
summary: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov confirmed the meeting to reporters on Monday, including AFP, but hasn't issued any further comments. Trump said the two would discuss 'land' and power plants, an apparent reference to the Moscow-controlled Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant in south Ukraine.

title: Emilie Dequenne: Belgian actress dies after months of battling rare cancer
summary: Dequenne died on Sunday, at the age of 43. A remission last May enabled her to celebrate the 25th anniversary of 'Rosetta,' the film that made her name and won her Best Actress at Cannes, in 1999.

title: French minister says U-turn on retirement age 'not realistic'
summary: The government has indicated in recent days that it would not budge on the reform's flagship measure, an increase in the retirement age from 62 to 64.

title: Drug trafficking in France: How a consensual bill became politically divisive
summary: The bill, which was passed unanimously in the Sénat, will be subject to a more tense debate in the Assemblée, starting on Monday.

title: The quoll, a threatened strangeness
summary: In February, 24 individuals of this species were released into a 6,000-hectare sanctuary in the heart of Tasmania, in the hope of halting the decline of this funny little animal.

title: Five years after Covid, people who left Paris region for more nature aren't looking back
summary: Lockdown heightened the desire of many Paris region residents to relocate for more space and greenery. While the flow has since slowed, many of them feel they made the right choice by taking advantage of new remote work opportunities and leaving the capital and its surroundings.

title: 'The upheavals caused by Trump's return can give the feeling of being in a dystopia come true'
summary: In France, two books published at the start of the year imagine a near-future in which far-right politician Marine Le Pen becomes president. According to their authors, such a scenario would have consequences for the rule of law, writes Le Monde journalist Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: The French university welcoming American researchers targeted by Trump's administration
summary: Aix-Marseille University wants to fund the work of some 15 academics in fields targeted by the new US administration.

title: WHO chief warns US aid cuts could cost millions of lives
summary: World Health Organization chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that disruptions to global HIV programs alone 'could undo 20 years of progress, leading to more than 10 million additional cases of HIV and three million HIV related deaths.'

title: Surprise Israeli air strikes on Gaza leave at least 66 dead, shattering ceasefire
summary: Israel says it has 'resumed fighting' in Gaza, launching its heaviest airstrikes since January and killing at least 66 people, after accusing Hamas of obstructing hostage negotiations. Hamas, in turn, condemned the strikes as a breach of the ceasefire that jeopardizes hostage talks.

title: Global growth slows amid trade tensions with the US
summary: Growth in Canada and Mexico is likely to see the biggest stall if Donald Trump's 25% tariffs are maintained.

title: In 'drug-ravaged' Brussels, 'Batman' restores order
summary: As experts sound the alarm over the Belgian capital losing the fight against drug trafficking, the new public prosecutor, Julien Moinil, is stepping up arrests.

title: Niger quits international group of French-speaking nations
summary: The West African country announced that it would leave the Organisation Internationale de la Francophonie. It comes after the country left the regional bloc ECOWAS in January.

title: How a new generation of pro-Palestinian activists is taking root on French campuses
summary: While mobilization remains limited to a few universities and a minority of a few hundred students, the war in Gaza has affected a diverse cohort in the midst of their intellectual development.

title: Thousands of French students have had the door to Canada slammed in their faces
summary: Many students have found themselves at a loss since Ottawa changed the criteria for getting a student visa. But Canada's withdrawal could benefit countries such as France, which may see an influx of foreign students as a result.

title: Unpopular and lost, US Democrats are counting on Trump's chaos for revival
summary: Sidelined by Donald Trump's demolition campaign, and lacking a driving principle and the figures to embody it, the party is relying on grassroots activists. A nationwide day of protest is scheduled for April 5.

title: Police evict young migrants from Paris theater after months-long occupation
summary: Early on Tuesday morning, police officers and gendarmes pushed back a cordon formed in front of the theater by activists supporting the occupation of the young exiles, some of whom had been present in this Paris cultural venue since December 10.

title: Trump and Putin to hold 'very critical' phone call amid talks on Ukraine
summary: US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are set to hold a high-stakes phone call Tuesday, with hopes of finalizing a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine.

title: Chicken mafé, bissap juice and keumeukh fritters: Sharing Senegal's cuisine
summary: 'Home-made!' Our food journalist explores your home kitchens. In Binta Wade's Boulogne-Billancourt home, he learns how to make tasty Senegalese specialties.

title: By massively bombing Gaza, Netanyahu destroys ceasefire with Hamas
summary: The Israeli army resumed its offensive on the territory, killing more than 400 Palestinians on Tuesday, according to the Ministry of Health in Gaza. Israel accuses Hamas of refusing to compromise on negotiations to free the hostages.

title: Trump eyes Canada's water to fight shortages in the US
summary: Washington has suspended negotiations on the Columbia River Treaty, which meanders for almost 2,000 kilometers between the two countries.

title: Netanyahu looks to fire intelligence chief, triggering political crisis
summary: The Shin Bet intelligence agency is investigating some of the prime minister's aides. Its director, who acknowledged his responsibility for the security fiasco that led to the October 7 attack, also pointed to the government's failings. This is the first time that a Shin Bet leader has been pushed out.

title: Diplomatic crisis between France and Algeria worsens
summary: French Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau announced the start of a 'graduated response' by France following Algeria's refusal to accept a list of people to be deported.

title: Hungarian parliament passes a bill banning Pride events
summary: The amendment to Hungary's 'child protection' legislation, making it an offense to hold events for LGBTQ+ rights, passed with 136 votes in favor to 27.
